title: Abiky
author: Abiky
content: Besides Casascius, Lealana, and Denarium coins, which other crypto collectibles are the most valuable? I'm talking about physical items like bars, coins, and art. Not NFTs which can magically disappear in an instant. It would be good to have an ordered list from the most expensive crypto collectible to the most affordable one. This would be for anyone's reference in case they want to know if the collectible they're holding is worth some serious cash or all the other way around.Your input will be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

comments.author: Dernoste
comments.body: for me the best are Squirrelbits!!no doubt!!!

comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: Squirrelbits. One 21 made per drop. Pure art.

comments.author: Crytocanuk
comments.body: +1 for Squirrelbits… rarity and quality are second to none.

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: I know collectibles  can be very subjective , but I believe a lot of folks would go with The Times Newspaper- Referenced in Genesis block of Bitcoin03/Jan/2009But if anyone hasn’t seen this thread by Krogoth - it’s  worth a good scroll   https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5107629.320You may well find a few gems in there that you haven’t seen before

comments.author: Ballhog69
comments.body: Crypto imperator.. been around since 2014 and still active.. low qty releases, aswell some of the first altcoin releases (doge)In the future the 1btc or even .1 btc might price out most people. CI's coins are the perfect combo of history, low serials, and low denominations which keeps og funded coins available to newcomers

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: 2018 Topps Allen & Ginter #83 Cryptocurrency 4x printing plates (black, cyan, magenta, yellow)

comments.author: thiago007
comments.body: Personally, I really like the OGNASTY coins, especially the gold ones. They are incredible. The difference with the Casacius is that they are limited. I think there are very few of them and it is almost impossible to buy any.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on August 31, 2022, 07:24:12 PM2018 Topps Allen & Ginter #83 Cryptocurrency 4x printing plates (black, cyan, magenta, yellow)Or the yet to be found silver mini!

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: So, I assume you mean based on personal valuation?If not, obviously some of the earliest or 1st edition coins are probably the most valueable (just talking premiums). Cas, Lealana, BTCCs... Ideally loaded, otherwise they lack an important part of what makes a crypto-collectible exciting (imho).Personally trust and quality and appearance play the most important role to my evaluation.I really like CI coins, clean but strong designs (mostly), affordable, low mintages and a reputation reaching back to 2014.Then some of the Lealanas are just amazing, starting from the 0.1 - 1.0 BTC silver coins (those with gilt look fantastic), but also the XMR set or some of the rare BTC set editions were incredibly artistic in design.And yes, ofc I really like Moonbits, my favourite is probably the 0.005 BTC titan finish chip - the hologram combined with the dark colouring and a decent loading and low mintage make it a perfect collectible in my eyes.

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: You mean the long game? Anything prefork on precious metals will be highly sought after. Most gold pieces have very limited mintages too.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Well here is one of my all-time faves. The 1000 XMR gold made by luigi in 2015-2016...  I think only 20 or 30 were ever made but not positive... https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1502918.0Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on August 31, 2022, 11:51:46 PMYou mean the long game? Anything prefork on precious metals will be highly sought after. Most gold pieces have very limited mintages too. 100% IMO as well...

comments.author: Todamont
comments.body: Some people collect old silver and gold rounds with bitcoin themes, and low mintage. Historically rare and important coins have been known to fetch multiples of their melt value as high as 30-50x or even higher. I prefer coins that are NOT meant to be "physical bitcoins" because there are separate risks associated with those, and I think the stickers degrade the beauty and longevity of the coin.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Maybe anything that is uber-rare and not necessarily a (loaded) coin....Items that we have maybe seen only 1 of..  like the Braille Bitcoin Whitepaper book!!

comments.author: BitcoinPenny
comments.body: Quote from: andulolika on August 31, 2022, 03:23:35 PMPersonaly, I love kialara.My favorite, too. Regards,Chris

comments.author: Frank AlpenCoin
comments.body: The 1000 XMR gold is wow... the  CI 1'000'000 dogecoin is wow as well.I like the Roman Booteen Bitcoin Coin. Pure art, amazing work and unique (1 of 1).https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5347708.0
